intro: Staurogyne expansa, commonly known as the broadleaf water milfoil, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its dense, floating or submerged foliage. The plant has small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically appearing in late summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a waxy texture. Staurogyne expansa is often found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats, such as ponds and lakes.
